required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine differences in nicotine delivery, use behavior, carbon monoxide delivery, subjective effects, and physiological effects, when cigarette smokers use an electronic cigarette with constant device settings and different e-liquid concentrations.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: The purpose of this study is to determine differences in nicotine delivery, use behavior, (puff topography), and carbon monoxide delivery, subjective effects, and physiological effects, when cigarette smokers use an electronic cigarette with constant device settings and different e-liquid concentrations.
study_design_info.masking_description: Participants will be blinded to the power level and nicotine concentration used in each session.

primary_outcome.description: Change in plasma nicotine concentration Blood will be taken 5 times in each session to examine changes from baseline (approx. 90 minutes) to immediately follow a ten-puff bout (approx. 100, 120, and 190 minutes), and immediately after the cigarette challenge paradigm (approx. 205 minutes).

primary_outcome.time_frame: This task will occur at approximiately 200 minutes until 205 minutes
primary_outcome.description: The cigarette challenge paradigm is a procedure in which participants will be given a 5 minute time period in which they are allowed to smoke their own brand cigarette as much or as little as they want. Study staff will provide the participant with their own brand cigarettes, a lighter, and an ash tray. Latency to start the first puff and number of puffs will be recorded.

secondary_outcome.description: Change in heart rate, measured in beats per minute.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Puff volume will be measured during the approximately 5-minute, 10-puff use bout.
secondary_outcome.description: The volume of each puff, in ml.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Puff duration will be measured during the approximately 5-minute, 10-puff use bout.
secondary_outcome.description: The duration of each puff, measured in second.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Inter puff interval will be measured during the approximately 5-minute, 10-puff use bout.
secondary_outcome.description: The time between each puff, in seconds.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Flow rate will be measured during the approximately 5-minute, 10-puff use bout.
secondary_outcome.description: The rate of air flow during each puff, in ml/second.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: This measure will be administered at approximately 90, 100, 120, 190, and 205 minutes.
secondary_outcome.description: This measure is related to the effects of vaping (10 questions, each scored from 0 - 100).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: This measure will be administered at approximately 90, 100, 120, 190, and 205 minutes.
secondary_outcome.description: This measure is related to the side effects of nicotine (10 questions, each scored from 0 - 100).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: This measure will be administered at approximately 90, 100, 120, 190, and 205 minutes.
secondary_outcome.description: This measure is related to nicotine abstinence symptoms (11 questions, each scored from 0 - 100).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: This measure will be administered at approximately 90, 100, 120, 190, and 205 minutes.
secondary_outcome.description: This measure is related to perceptions of electronic cigarette effects (3 questions, each scored from 0 - 100).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: This measure will be administered at approximately 90, 100, 120, 190, and 205 minutes.
secondary_outcome.description: This measure is related to perceptions of electronic cigarette effects (4 questions, each scored from 0 - 100).

arm_group.description: ECIG Lab Session, 30 watts, 0 mg/ml nicotine concentration During each session, participants will first complete a 10-puff product use bout, and then a 90-minute ad lib product use bout.
ECIG Lab Session, 30 watts, 4 mg/ml nicotine concentration During each session, participants will first complete a 10-puff product use bout, and then a 90-minute ad lib product use bout.
ECIG Lab Session, 30 watts, 15 mg/ml nicotine concentration During each session, participants will first complete a 10-puff product use bout, and then a 90-minute ad lib product use bout.
ECIG Lab Session, 30 watts, 30 mg/ml nicotine concentration During each session, participants will first complete a 10-puff product use bout, and then a 90-minute ad lib product use bout.

intervention.description: During each session, participants will first complete a 10-puff product use bout, and then a 90-minute ad lib product use bout.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- healthy (determined by self-report)
- between the ages of 18-55
- willing to provide informed consent
- able to attend the lab and abstain from tobacco/nicotine as required and must agree to use designated products according to study protocol
Exclusion Criteria:
â€¢ Women if they are breast-feeding or test positive for pregnancy (by urinalysis) at screening.
Some study details about the eligibility criteria are purposely omitted at this time to preserve scientific integrity. Full details will be posted at the conclusion of the study.

facility.name: Center for the Study of Tobacco Products
